p: Fatty acids with immune modulating properties mainly belong to the long-chain classes; among them, punicic acid is a peculiar conjugated triene, found to be a unique component of pomegranate seed oil [ 150], while oleic acid is one of the most widely distributed fatty acids: it represents 49% to 83% of total FA in olive oil, although it does occur in high amounts in other oils, such as those from grape seeds, canola and sufflower [ 151, 152].
